meanings.definition: A small green insect that feeds on plants.
meanings.sent1: The greenbugs were munching on the leaves of the rose bush.
meanings.sent2: The farmer sprayed the greenbugs with insecticide to protect his crops.
meanings.sent3: The greenbugs had a feast on the garden, leaving the plants looking like Swiss cheese.
meanings.sent4: The greenbugs spread across the field like a hungry army, devouring everything in their path.
meanings.sent5: The greenbugs swarmed the garden, turning it into a buffet for their leafy appetites.

meanings.definition: A person who is inexperienced or naive.
meanings.sent1: The new intern was a greenbug in the office, not knowing where anything was.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a greenbug in the city, lost and unsure of what to do.
meanings.sent3: He was such a greenbug when it came to relationships, always falling for the wrong person.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, he was a greenbug among sharks, easily taken advantage of.
meanings.sent5: The young detective was a greenbug in the world of crime, learning the ropes as he went along.
